anchor.surface_text: On April 2, 1973, the District Magistrate, Sibasagar, Jorhat in the said State, passed an order under S. 3 2  read with.s. 3 1   a  ii  of the Maintenance of Internal Security Act, 1971 for detaining the petitioner in the Jorhat jail. Accordingly, he was so detained.

facts.text: Writ Petition No. 1520 of 1973 filed in Original Writ Jurisdiction under Article 32

anchor.surface_text: ORIGINAL WRIT JURISDICTION Writ Petition No. 1520 of 1973. Under Article 32 of the Constitution for issue of a Writ in the nature of habeas companypus.

facts.text: Petition heard by the court on October 30 1973

anchor.surface_text: The petition was heard by us on October 30, 1973. After hearing companynsel for the parties we were of opinion that the petition should be allowed.

facts.text: Court passed order directing release of the petitioner on October 30 1973

anchor.surface_text: After hearing companynsel for the parties we were of opinion that the petition should be allowed. Accordingly, we passed an order directing the release of the petitioner.

facts.text: District Magistrate detained petitioner to prevent acting prejudicial to maintenance of public order

anchor.surface_text: The District Magistrate has detained the petitioner with a view to preventing him from acting in any manner prejudicial to maintenance of public order.

facts.text: Grounds of detention are 16 in number

anchor.surface_text: Grounds of detention are. 16 in number Some of the grounds do relate to public order, and it is number necessary to set them out here.

facts.text: Petitioner spoke ill of State Government and Assamese people in a meeting in last part of March 1961 at residence of Shri Hemendra Kishore Roy Jorhat when he was Secretary of Refugee Association Assam

anchor.surface_text: Those grounds are That he spoke ill of the State Government, and the Assamese people in a camera meeting in the last part of March, 1961 held at the residence of Shri Hemendra kishore Roy, Jorhat. Then he was Secretary of the Refugee Association, Assam.

facts.text: Petitioner issued Press Statement on 6-12-1971 on Pak atrocities in East Pakistan Bangla Desh blaming General Yahya Khan and American Government

anchor.surface_text: That he issued a Press Statement on 6-12-1971 on the Pak atrocities in East- Pakistan  Bangla Desh  blaming General Yahaya Khan and the American Government.

facts.text: Petitioner sent telegram on 22-11-1971 to Mr Kenneth Keating American Ambassador in India to stop mass killing in East Pakistan

anchor.surface_text: Another telegram was sent on 22-11-71 to Mr. Kenneth Keating, American Ambassador in India, to stop mass killing in East Pakistan. That he challenged the census operation in Assam

facts.text: Petitioner challenged census operation in Assam stating Assamese population figures highly inflated at cost of Bengalis

anchor.surface_text: That he challenged the census operation in Assam and stated that the figures of Assamese population were shown highly inflated at the companyt of Bengalis. That he sent a telegram on 10-10-1972

facts.text: Petitioner sent telegram on 10-10-1972 to Prime Minister India on language movement in Assam with highly exaggerated and false contents

anchor.surface_text: That he sent a telegram on 10-10-1972 to the Prime Minister, India on the language movement in Assam. The companytents of the telegram were highly exaggerated and false.

facts.text: Petitioner sent exaggerated telegram on 31-12-1972 to Prime Minister India requesting not to enter into language settlement with Cachar leaders signed as acting President

anchor.surface_text: That he sent another exaggerated telegram on requesting 31-12-1972 to the Prime, Minister, India her number to enter into any language settlement with 2 79 Cachar loaders. He signed the telegram as the Councils acting President.
